Tit. 9 ยง 3.84 - Executive Order No. 84: Directing that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into active service the organized militia to assist authorities in guaranteeing public safety and protecting property in the Village of Port Byron, Cayuga County, New York
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.84 - Executive Order No. 84: Directing that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into active service the organized militia to assist authorities in guaranteeing public safety and protecting property in the Village of Port Byron, Cayuga County, New York

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, by virtue of authority vested in me as

Governor, under the Military Law of the State, do hereby direct by Executive

Order that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into the active service of
the State, for such period, to such extent, and in such manner as he may deem
necessary, all or any part of the organized militia to assist agencies in the

Village of Port Byron, Cayuga County, New York, in alleviating the effects of a
severe ice jam on the Owasco outlet of Owasco Lake. (1)

Major General Vito J. Castellano, Chief
of Staff to the Governor, is hereby appointed commander of all personnel
ordered into the active service of the State. (2)

Units and members of the organized
militia to be designated by order of the Chief of Staff to the Governor will
immediately assemble at their local armories when ordered, and will remain
assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the Chief of Staff
to the Governor. (3)

All
enlistments, reenlistments, or voluntary extension of enlistments which expire
after 15 February 1979 and during the period for which the members are
currently ordered into the active service of the State are hereby extended for
the duration of such duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: February 14, 1979
PROCLAMATION
WHEREAS, the Governor is Commander-in-Chief of the Militia
of the State, pursuant to the Constitution of the State as restated in Section
three
of the

Military Law; and
WHEREAS, pursuant to the provisions of Section
six
of the Military

Law, the Governor as Commander-in-Chief of the Militia has the power to order
into the active service of the State in case of disaster or imminent danger
thereof, such units of the organized militia which may be necessary to assist
authority in protecting life and prpoerty, in maintaining essential life
services and to alleviate damages and losses caused by ice jams and flooding; and
WHEREAS, the public interest requires such action at the

State level for the preservation of public and private property and the welfare
of the population of the Village of Port Byron, Cayuga County, New York: NOW THEREFORE, I, HUGH L. CAREY, Governor of the State of

New York, pursuant to authority vested in me by Subdivision one of Section
six
of the Military

Law, have this day, by Executive Order, ordered Major General Vito J. Castellano, the Chief of Staff to the Governor, to order into the active
service of the State, for such period, to such extent and in such manner as he
may deem necessary, all or part of the organized militia to meet this
emergency. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: February 14, 1979
